column2: What does a xor linked list have?
column3: every node stores the XOR of addresses of previous and next nodes
column4: actuall memory address of next node
column5: every node stores the XOR of addresses of previous and next two nodes
column6: every node stores xor 0 and the current node address

column2: What does first and last nodes of a xor linked lists contain ? (let address of first and last be A and B)
column3: NULL xor A and B xor NULL

column2: Which of the following is an advantage of XOR list?
column3: Almost of debugging tools cannot follow the XOR chain, making debugging difficult
column4: You need to remember the address of the previously accessed node in order to calculate the next node’s address
column5: In some contexts XOR of pointers is not defined
column6: XOR list decreases the space requirement in doubly linked list
